titleStmt.title: A Transcription of Codex Bezae (Latin side)
GA 05
The New Testament

respStmt.name: the International Greek New Testament Project

sponsor.name: The Institute for Textual Scholarship and Electronic Editing

publisher.name: The International Greek New Testament Project (IGNTP)

availability.p: Available for noncommercial re-use provided attribution is made to the original creator and funder and the subsequent derivative is licensed as ShareAlike (Creative Commons by-nc-sa)

projectDesc.p: This transcription was prepared by the International Greek New Testament Project in collaboration with Cambridge University Library. The XML transcription was produced according to the subset of the TEI guidelines set out at . The following have contributed to the Latin transcription: D.C. Parker, H.A.G. Houghton, C.M. Kreinecker, S.J. Gibson, A.I. Conway-Jones, C.J. Smith, J. Balserak.

A base text of the Stuttgart Vulgate was altered to correspond to the reading of the manuscript, and details of layout and paratext added. For the identification of scribal hands in corrections and paratext, Scrivener's 1864 transcription was followed (Adnotationes editoris), as amended in Parker's 1992 monograph (Appendix 2). The source of corrections not recorded in either of these sources was identified by Parker.
This transcription has been deposited on the University of Birmingham Institutional Research Archive, at

revisionDesc.change: Proofread transcriptions of each book combined to produce a single file (version 1.0).
Latin files combined to produce an initial single file (version 0.1).

ab.note: Folio 7r is a supplement added by a later hand.

seg.note: The ink page number is illegible
f.7 gone

ab.note: The overline has been added by hand G; there is also a line in the margin indicating a new section.

ab.note: 8 folios are missing, covering Matt. 6:8 to 8:27a
The top margin of this page, including one line of Latin text, is missing
Therre is an arrow above the first 't' of 'dimittuntur'.
The correction may be to 'utroque', with an 'o' rather than a deletion point above the letter 's'.
Blemish on parchment in middle of 'autem'

seg.note: Possible erasure in middle of 'mattheum'?

ab.note: Chemicals have been applied to the first two lines of this page.
There is damage to the top right-hand corner of the page, with replacement parchment added; however, the Latin text appears to be preserved in full.
There is an apostrophe after 'ab' in order to ensure the correct word division
The dash under the 'c' of 'colligit' appears to be without significance.

seg.note: This chapter number was subsequently erased and inserted seven lines above.

ab.note: Chemicals have been applied to the lower half of this page

seg.note: Possibly corrected from XIIII

ab.note: Scrivener records a correction from 'c' to 'g' but the 'g' seems first hand
There is a hole in the middle of 'istam', predating the copying of the manuscript.
The first hand has inserted an extra line after line 26, making 34 lines on the page.
The first hand has inserted an extra line after line 4, making 34 lines on the page.

seg.note: This annotation in the right margin has been partly obscured.

ab.note: There is a natural hole in the parchment in this and the next line, but it does not affect the text.
Hand G has added a stroke above 'hoc'

The correction is provided at the bottom of the page; the last letter is a downwards arrow connecting it to the arrow inserted in the text after 'terram'. G initially added 'erant' at the end of the addition, then erased this and re-wrote the arrow.

ab.note: The last three lines are added in the right margin
Folio 171r is a supplement added by a later hand.
Folio 172r is a supplement added by a later hand.
Folio 173r is a supplement added by a later hand.

The entire page was initially a copy of fol. 171r by the supplementary hand (John 18:25-38) with the same line breaks. This has been washed off and the current text written instead. Chemicals have been applied to the end of lines 1-10 and 16-17, where the original writing can be read clearly.
The text on the rest of this line is from the underwriting repeating fol. 171r - see note above.
Folio 174r is a supplement added by a later hand.
Folio 175r is a supplement added by a later hand.

div.note: There is no folio 176r. The text resumes on fol. 177r, the first page of volume two, with the duplication of one word.

seg.note: ff. 169-176 gone

ab.note: A decorative line in normal ink of two interwoven lines
A correction from 'hierodis' is recorded by Kipling, but this seems unlikely.
Certain faint characters in the lower half of the page have been retraced by a later hand.
The hand responsible for the reinking has added a superline to represent the characters lost through damage to the parchment.
The last three letters of 'recedebat' are written in the line beneath.

seg.note: The second running title is written by a later hand, which may also be responsible for the addition of the word 'parentes'.
There is a blemish in the middle of 'lucan'

ab.note: The characters 'eci' are underlined.
The characters 'ph' are underlined.

seg.note: The Greek numerals indicate the transposition of lines as identified by a corrector.

ab.note: The first five letters of 'custodit' have been retraced by hand K

seg.note: The Greek numerals indicate the transposition of lines.

ab.note: The strokes added above the space indicate the relocation of the line four lines below by corrector K.

seg.note: There is an extra mark next to B indicating the relocation of this line by corrector K, corresponding to one added four lines above.

ab.note: There is a hole in the parchment which does not affect the text.
Ink from the opposite page has transferred onto the 'd' of 'sedens'.
The word 'drachma(m)' is written beneath the line.
The semicolon may have been added to separate this line from 'drachma(m)' added below the line above.
A #-shaped sign is written at the edge of the right margin.
There is a hole in the manuscript but it does not affect the text.
The first hand has added the omitted line in the space above the following line, thereby creating an extra line on this page.

seg.note: The Greek numerals in the margin indicate that the lines have been transposed
The ink trailing from the final 'i' of 'xxii' may be a deletion: the modern chapter number is 21.

ab.note: The dots below the second 'e' of 'quaerebant' may have transferred from the opposite page.
Scrivener suggests that this correction may be in the hand of Bentley.
The first hand has re-written the 'r' of 'atrio'.

seg.note: The Greek numerals in the margin indicate a transposition of lines.

ab.note: There is a short vertical stroke between these words, which may have been erased.
